snippet: Years ago, two lawyers saw Microsoft’s fast grip on the PC software market as anticompetitive. Today, they disagree on whether Google represents a similar force in search.
abstract: Lawyers Gary L Reback and Susan A Creighton represented Netscape in landmark 1996 antitrust case against Microsoft, but now find themselves on opposing sides in similar case against Google; Reback feels strongly that Google is anti-competitive, while Creighton argues consumers, free to choose alternatives, flock to Google because of superior service.
lead_paragraph: Years ago, two lawyers saw Microsoft’s fast grip on the PC software market as anticompetitive. Today, they disagree on whether Google represents a similar force in search.

headline.seo: Is Google Abusing Its Market Power? Former Legal Allies Disagree
headline.main: Onetime Allies in Antitrust Part Ways Over Google
headline.print_headline: Onetime Allies in Antitrust Part Ways Over Google
